content.description:
Start sitting with right hand on a very bad slimper and left on the arete. Use a heel to pull up into a good left handed edge. Reposition yourself and dyno to the huge edge on the face. Go straight up to a fun exit.  

  A stand start can be done at v7/8. Start standing with left on the good edge on the arete and right on the slimper or sharp micro edge. Complete the dyno and climb the rest of it.
content.location: This is the overhanging arete on the left side of the boulder as you approach it from the trail.

content.description: start on two crimps lower than the large hueco with left hand a right hand below the large rail cross to the rail and go straight up using the side pull sloper and a crimp to the large jug and top out.
Same start as "Flying Colors," except make a large shouldery move right to a flat ledge. Level up and go to a left handed slimper and slap for the shelf. Fun moves.
content.location: Just right of "flying colors" on the back side of the boulder. (Two climbs right of the left arete on the back.

content.description: Start on the slimper rail right of "Taxed." Move up right handed to a gaston (second hold on Price of Liberty) and high step to get a left gaston. Move left out of the double gaston into "Taxed" an finish straight up.
Start on a low edge and climb straight up through large undercling features to a tall mantle.
content.location: As you approach the boulder, this is the tall arete just right of the plaque. See video in comments for details.

content.description: Start for Sons of Freedom and finish on Hessians
content.location: Same start as Sons of Freedom

content.description: Stand start on the edge/jug that you dyno to on "Wrapped in the Flag." Move right to a side pull and make a long move into a a scoop at the lip. Mantle it out.
content.location: One climb right of Wrapped in the Flag.

content.description: Squat starting with left on a crimp and right on a very low undercling side pull. Pull on and grab two perfect slopers. Jump to the lip. Fun. An easier, indirect variation exists if you move right into the giant flake feature and up.
content.location: One climb right of Hessians, just left of the arete.

content.description: Climb the obvious Z crack from a sit.
content.location: Middle of the boulder as you approach from the trail.

content.description: An alternate version of The Revolutionary Prow. Less pumpy, but adds a few moves. Start with left hand on the larger crimp to the left of the standard start and right hand the same as the standard start. Bump up and left to the rail and then bring your left foot up onto the jug below the rail. From here you can bump right to the good crimp above the right hand sloper and finish as you would the normal route.
Start as for Revolutionary Prow but match the slower and continue directly out the prow to a mantle at the apex of the overhang.
content.location: Overhanging prow on back side of boulder. Same start as Revolutionary Prow.

content.description: Under the obvious huge prow on the backside of the boulder, start matched on two half pad crimps. Make a long move to a big sloper with the right hand. Catch a good left hand around the other side of the prow and go straight up to a tricky mantle.
content.location: Right in the middle of the obvious big prow on the back side of the boulder.

content.description: Start sitting in a perfect mail slot. Pull off the ground into a right hand undercling/sidepull. Work directly up through veritcal compression features and a right handed slot to gain the lip.

Start just below the plaque on the boulder left of "Taxed." Right hand side pull around the arete and left on a large side pull. Pull on and work your way over  the low bulge using a left handed sloper rail and right handed pinch. Top out direct.
Stand starting on a right hand rounded side pull and a slimper. Pull on and lunge to a sloped shelf.
content.location: Just right of the Price of Liberty

content.description: Squeezed between "Hessions" and "Sons of Freedom"... Start matched on the left sloper of "Sons of Freedom," dyno left to slot jug below lip.
content.location: Just left of Sons of Freedom

content.description: Start in the hueco feature just right of the arete. Pull on and make a long move up and left to a huge sloper. Directly to the top from there.
content.location: On the back side of the boulder just right of the left arete (Sons of Freedom is just left around the corner).

content.description: Just left of "Wrapped in the Flag." Start with left on a side pull rail, right on a good edge under the roof, left heel. Pull on and throw for a right pinch on the arete. Make a big move left to a good side pull and establish on the face. Fantastic compression moves.
content.location: Climb the left side of the arete that houses "Wrapped on the Flag"

content.description:
Roadside boulder in Richmond, NH with outstanding rock quality and a variety of quality climbs from V0-V10.

UPDATE: Please do not overly chalk wet holds, leave tick marks or any other signs of your activity at this boulder. Practice leave no trace at this boulder (and everything you do outside for that matter) or you will ruin it for future climbers. If the boulder is wet, move on to a another line or area and return when it dries. This wonderful boulder has seen dramatically increased traffic in the past few years. Please be respectful.
